item.title: SDS for School Leavers
item.description:
SDS for School Leavers – Key Learning Points

  • Schools and social work services need to work out better ways of identifying pupils that may be eligible for social work support from age 14. Local authority transitions teams could achieve this.
  • Parents and carers are often assumed to know more about the transition process than they actually do. There is a need for timely and relevant information from age 14 onwards. A Transitions Table at Parents Nights would be a good means of providing this information.
  • The prospect of change can be very unsettling for final year pupils, intensely so for those with autism. Close attention should be paid to anxiety management. Relaxation sessions can help. 
  • Technology can engage young people in planning for the future. Young people are often more digitally literate than practitioners and this can shift the balance of power WITTY (What’s Important to You?)
  • School leavers and their parents/carers found visits to support provider organisations helpful in understanding the types of support available.
  • Small ‘test budgets’ to try out activities and supports can help final year pupils and their supporters plan for the future.
  • Imaginative ways of facilitating school leavers and parents/carers to explore and commission shared supports are needed. Locality-based transitions forums could support this.
  • Keeping in touch and sharing information with other parents and young people can be managed through a closed Facebook group.

item.title: Test Budgets
item.description:
Who is it for? 
Test budgets are for people planning their support and their supporters.
What does it do? 

The personalised ‘Taking the First Steps’ account is for people to record what they have spent their test budget on and what their outcomes have been.

How can you use it? 
Test budgets can be used to give people the opportunity to try out different activities and supports before including them in their support plans. They can also give people the opportunity to try managing small sums of money before deciding on which SDS option to choose.

item.title: Locality Based Transitions Forum (Solution Card)
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The Locality Based Transitions Forum Solution Card is for anyone interested in establishing a transitions forum in their locality.
What does it do? 

The Locality Based Transitions Forum  Solution Card is an outline plan for the establishement of a locality based transitions forum.

How can you use it? 
The Locality Based Transitions Forum Solution Card can be used as a design template for locality based transitions forums.

item.title: Transitions Table at Parents Nights (Solution Card)
item.description:
Who is it for? 
The Transitions Table Solution Card is for anyone interested in setting up a transitions table at parents nights.
What does it do? 

The Transitions Table Solution Card is an outline plan for organising a transitions table at parents nights.

How can you use it? 
The Transitions Table Solution Card can be used for organising a transitions table at parents night. It suggests people who could be involved, materials that could be provided and some possible next steps.
